intro: Seseli anomalum, commonly known as the anomalous seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley, carrots, and other aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of the carrot family. Seseli anomalum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, alpine environments.
